intro: Pimpinella saxifraga var. intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to theApiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive and relatively rare species within its native habitat.
